benchmark_details.name: H ALLU CODE
benchmark_details.overview: A benchmark for evaluating the performance of code LLMs in recognizing hallucinations, established based on a comprehensive analysis of hallucination types in generated code.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and improve the recognition and mitigation of hallucinations in code LLMs.
audience: Undergraduate and Graduate students in computer science
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Focus exclusively on Python code generation tasks.

data.annotation: Annotated with types of hallucinations present.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the proportion of correctly identified hallucinations and successful mitigations among generated codes.
methodology.interpretation: Recognized hallucinations and effectiveness of mitigation demonstrated through comparative analysis with HumanEval.
methodology.validation: Cross-validated with multiple annotators for labeling of hallucination types.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Generated code does not contain personally identifiable information.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data used from existing benchmarks is compliant with associated licenses.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Data sources are publicly available and do not require consent-related issues.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: All data used complies with data protection and copyright regulations.
